alert.note: Alert for Pulaski (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 05 at 7:34AM CDT until May 06 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Springfield MO has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Missouri... Roubidoux Creek Near Waynesville affecting Pulaski County. Gasconade River at Hazelgreen affecting Laclede County. .Heavy rainfall received overnight combined with additional rainfall possible today will cause rivers in the Gasconade Basin to rise above flood stage. For the Roubidoux Creek...including Waynesville...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Gasconade River Basin...including Jerome, Hazelgreen... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Roubidoux Creek near Waynesville. * WHEN...From this morning to tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, the RV Park on the west side of Roubidoux in Waynesville just north of the Business 66 bridge floods. Spring Road near I-44 floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 5.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning to a crest of 8.8 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.0 feet on 05/18/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. Friday morning at 745 AM CDT.
